docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's administration was unexpectedly on the winning side in nearly all the close, politically significant Supreme Court cases decided in the term that ended this week, including blockbuster rulings on Obamacare and gay marriage.

headline.main: In Supreme Court Term, Obama Wins Big and Loses Small
headline.print_headline: In Supreme Court Term, Obama Wins Big and Loses Small

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama's administration was unexpectedly on the winning side in nearly all the close, politically significant Supreme Court cases decided in the term that ended this week, including blockbuster rulings on Obamacare and gay marriage.

headline.main: My Son’s Flag Is Not My Familiar Stars and Stripes

docs.abstract: To my son, the 4th of July is just another day. But I’ve come to understand it’s not so much my nationality I want him to identify with—it’s me.
docs.snippet: To my son, the 4th of July is just another day. But I’ve come to understand it’s not so much my nationality I want him to identify with—it’s me.

docs.lead_paragraph: The former owner of a Massachusetts funeral home accused of improperly caring for dead bodies and embezzling more than $375,000 from clients has been indicted on additional charges.

headline.main: Ex-Funeral Director Indicted on Additional Charges
headline.print_headline: Ex-Funeral Director Indicted on Additional Charges

docs.snippet: The former owner of a Massachusetts funeral home accused of improperly caring for dead bodies and embezzling more than $375,000 from clients has been indicted on additional charges.

docs.lead_paragraph: Aetna aims to spend about $35 billion to buy rival Humana and become the latest health insurer bulking up on government business as the industry adjusts to the federal health care overhaul.

headline.main: Aetna to Buy Humana as Health Insurer Landscape Shifts
headline.print_headline: Aetna to Buy Humana as Health Insurer Landscape Shifts

docs.snippet: Aetna aims to spend about $35 billion to buy rival Humana and become the latest health insurer bulking up on government business as the industry adjusts to the federal health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health insurer Aetna Inc on Friday said it would buy smaller rival Humana Inc for about $37 billion in cash and stock, in the largest ever deal in the insurance industry.

headline.main: Aetna to Buy Humana for $37 Billion in Largest Insurance Deal
headline.print_headline: Aetna to Buy Humana for $37 Billion in Largest Insurance Deal

docs.snippet: Health insurer Aetna Inc on Friday said it would buy smaller rival Humana Inc for about $37 billion in cash and stock, in the largest ever deal in the insurance industry.

docs.lead_paragraph: The programs have helped millions of elderly, disabled and poor people, and have extended life expectancy in America.
docs.abstract: Editorial celebrates 50th anniversary of Medicare and Medicaid enactment, backbones of government health insurance that have successfully allowed eligible Americans to obtain necessary health care; outlines improvements that could be made in both programs to better serve nation and allow them to continue to withstand ideologically-driven, fear-based attacks.
docs.snippet: The programs have helped millions of elderly, disabled and poor people, and have extended life expectancy in America.

docs.lead_paragraph: A push for mergers among large insurers has gained momentum since the Supreme Court upheld a key part of the Obama administration’s health care law.

headline.main: Aetna Said to Be Near Deal to Buy Humana for $34 Billion
headline.print_headline: Aetna Deal for Humana Is Expected

docs.abstract: Aetna nears agreement to purchase rival Humana for about $34 billion in deal that is said to presage further consolidation among nation's biggest health insurers; would pay roughly $230 per share, nearly 29 percent premium over share price before deal talks emerged.
docs.snippet: A push for mergers among large insurers has gained momentum since the Supreme Court upheld a key part of the Obama administration’s health care law.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Elfman, who has scored nearly 100 movies, has reorchestrated 15 suites from the ones he made with Mr. Burton.

headline.main: Danny Elfman Brings Music From Tim Burton’s Films to Lincoln Center
headline.print_headline: 15 Suites in the Key of Darkness

docs.abstract: Excerpts from interview with composer and movie producer, Danny Elfman, whose latest project is series of Avery Fisher Hall concerts featuring re-orchestration of 15 suites from movie collaborations with Tim Burton.
docs.snippet: Mr. Elfman, who has scored nearly 100 movies, has reorchestrated 15 suites from the ones he made with Mr. Burton.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president likened Governor Walker and the other Republican presidential candidates to an uncle saying something that makes no sense.

headline.main: Obama, in Wisconsin, Takes On Scott Walker
headline.print_headline: Obama, in Wisconsin, Mocks Its Governor and Other G.O.P. Candidates

docs.abstract: Pres Obama, speaking in La Crosse, Wis, lets loose an extended mockery of Gov Scott Walker, who has entered crowded field of Republican presidential candidates.
docs.snippet: The president likened Governor Walker and the other Republican presidential candidates to an uncle saying something that makes no sense.
